articles.headline: Once a Coup, Pipeline Company Deal Becomes a Nightmare
articles.snippet: Shares of Energy Transfer Equity and the Williams Companies have plummeted, partly because of numerous concerns about their complicated merger.
articles.abstract: Shares of Energy Transfer Equity and the Williams Companies have plummeted, partly because of numerous concerns about their complicated merger.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the last decade, Kelcy Warren became one of the great beneficiaries of America’s energy boom. The son of a Texas oil-field worker, Mr. Warren built a multibillion-dollar fortune amassing a 71,000-mile network of pipelines across the United States.
articles.byline: By Leslie Picker and Julie Creswell

articles.headline: Netflix Aims for Family-Friendly Nostalgia With New Slate
articles.snippet: Starting with “Fuller House” on Friday, the streaming service has lined up shows harking back to the ’80s and ’90s, meant for family watching.
articles.abstract: Starting with “Fuller House” on Friday, the streaming service has lined up shows harking back to the ’80s and ’90s, meant for family watching.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the last couple of years, as Netflix has crashed the gates of the television industry, the service has aimed to attract all age groups. It created adult-oriented dramas like “Narcos” and “Orange Is the New Black,” developed more than two dozen original series for children and started a comedy, “Grace and Frankie,” starring four actors in their 70s.

articles.headline: Apple Goes to Court, and F.B.I. Presses Congress to Settle iPhone Privacy Fight
articles.snippet: In a court filing, Apple said the order had broad implications that would “inflict significant harm — to civil liberties, society and national security.”
articles.abstract: In a court filing, Apple said the order had broad implications that would “inflict significant harm — to civil liberties, society and national security.”
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The legal wrangling over a federal court order requiring Apple to help law enforcement break into an iPhone intensified Thursday, with the company filing its formal response and asking the court to drop its demand.
articles.byline: By Katie Benner, Eric Lichtblau and Nick Wingfield

articles.headline: Supreme Court Fight Won’t Die, No Matter How Hard Republicans Try
articles.snippet: Democrats continued their battle to fill the vacant court seat in the Senate on Thursday as Republicans held firm against doing so.
articles.abstract: Democrats continued their battle to fill the vacant court seat in the Senate on Thursday as Republicans held firm against doing so.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Republicans, facing fierce criticism from Democrats on Capitol Hill, insisted Thursday that they would face no political retribution from their decision to shun any Supreme Court nomination made by President Obama, expressing confidence that they would not be hurt at the polls in November.
articles.byline: By David M. Herszenhorn and Carl Hulse

articles.headline: Global Finance Leaders Meet as Economic Skies Darken
articles.snippet: Government and central bank officials are gathering in Shanghai with few easy answers to sluggishness in Europe, China and Japan.
articles.abstract: Government and central bank officials are gathering in Shanghai with few easy answers to sluggishness in Europe, China and Japan.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — The global economy looks shaky. Markets for things as diverse as oil and European bank shares have plumbed new lows. The tried-and-true cures no longer seem to work.

articles.headline: In College Endowment Returns, Davids Beat the Goliaths
articles.snippet: In the latest Nacubo-Commonfund study, endowments under $25 million averaged a five-year annualized return of 10.6 percent versus 10.4 in the $1 billion-plus category.
articles.abstract: In the latest Nacubo-Commonfund study, endowments under $25 million averaged a five-year annualized return of 10.6 percent versus 10.4 in the $1 billion-plus category.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the world of money management, bigger is often considered better. College and university endowments greater than $1 billion, for example, have long outperformed their smaller rivals.

articles.headline: U.S. Plans to Put Advisers on Front Lines of Nigeria’s War on Boko Haram
articles.snippet: The deployment of dozens of Special Operations advisers would push American troops hundreds of miles closer to the battle that Nigerian forces are waging against the militants.
articles.abstract: The deployment of dozens of Special Operations advisers would push American troops hundreds of miles closer to the battle that Nigerian forces are waging against the militants.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAKAR, Senegal — The Pentagon is poised to send dozens of Special Operations advisers to the front lines of Nigeria’s fight against the West African militant group Boko Haram, according to military officials, the latest deployment in conflicts with the Islamic State and its allies.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Dionne Searcey

articles.headline: In Republican Debate, a Feisty Marco Rubio Lays Into Donald Trump
articles.snippet: Senator Marco Rubio, alarmed by Donald Trump’s ascendancy and worried that his presidential chances were slipping away, delivered the onslaught that Republican leaders had desperately awaited.
articles.abstract: Senator Marco Rubio, alarmed by Donald Trump’s ascendancy and worried that his presidential chances were slipping away, delivered the onslaught that Republican leaders had desperately awaited.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Marco Rubio, alarmed by Donald J. Trump’s ascendancy and worried that his presidential chances were slipping away, unleashed a barrage of attacks on the real estate mogul’s business ethics, hiring practices and financial achievements in Thursday’s debate, forcefully delivering the onslaught that Republican leaders had desperately awaited.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and Matt Flegenheimer

articles.headline: In Rare Appearance, China’s Central Bank Chief Says All Is Well
articles.snippet: At a news conference at the start of a G-20 meeting, Zhou Xiaochuan dismissed concerns about erosion of China’s foreign currency reserves.
articles.abstract: At a news conference at the start of a G-20 meeting, Zhou Xiaochuan dismissed concerns about erosion of China’s foreign currency reserves.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — For the second time since last summer, an avuncular, graying man has stepped out of Beijing’s shadows and calmed financial markets after a Chinese devaluation — but once again, his assurances came after nearly a month of turmoil and growing worry about the country’s economic health.

articles.headline: An Insurance Penalty From Postpartum Depression
articles.snippet: Life and disability insurers sometimes set higher rates for women who suffer depression after childbirth, or decline coverage at all.
articles.abstract: Life and disability insurers sometimes set higher rates for women who suffer depression after childbirth, or decline coverage at all.
articles.lead_paragraph: In January, a government-appointed panel recommended that all pregnant women and new mothers be screened for depression. Public health advocates rejoiced, as did untold numbers of women who had not known that maternal mental illness even existed before it hit them like a freight train.

articles.headline: To Fight Critics, Donald Trump Aims to Instill Fear in 140-Character Doses
articles.snippet: As mainstream Republicans try to stop Mr. Trump’s rise, the specter of being bullied by him is discouraging others from joining the fight.
articles.abstract: As mainstream Republicans try to stop Mr. Trump’s rise, the specter of being bullied by him is discouraging others from joining the fight.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cheri Jacobus, a Republican political strategist, did not think she had done anything out of the ordinary: On a cable television show, she criticized Donald J. Trump for skipping a debate in Iowa in late January and described him as a “bad debater.”
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Keeping Investors on a Need-to-Know Basis
articles.snippet: Some investment advisers slip operational changes into their business brochures rather than highlighting them.
articles.abstract: Some investment advisers slip operational changes into their business brochures rather than highlighting them.
